title: There is a Void champion that is probably slated to be released soon
body:
Couple of hints towards this have been in the recent Targon story.

We know that their are many Aspects {{champion:80}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:44}}  uniting at the same time because something is coming.

Aurelion Sol has also been called back because something is coming.
In both Diana's and Aurelion Sol's  lore, they fight against **Void **creatures, particularly, in ASol's  lore he comments on there being a type of 'hive-mind' entity that is tearing a rift between dimensions and leading the void, he had to be called to stop it.

Not only is he being called again, but 4 other aspects have manifested at the same time. No other evil faction of Runaterra has been shown to offer resistance against Targon and ASol (Sol even comments on how everyone in runaterra is secretly 'conquered' by Targon and Shurima being the 'Premiere' civilization amongs humans, which likely puts them above the watchers).

So unless a new faction is going to be introduced to pose as threat, this only leaves the Void as a possible adversary to Targon and Aurelion.

I'm very familiar with all the shitty Formic knock-offs that have flooded out of bad sci-fi over the years, thanks.

Just because a swarm of things operates toward a common goal doesn't require a collective intelligence guiding them.  Nothing we've seen of the Void thus far suggests a hive-mind.  We've seen purely animal Voidborn.  We've seen intelligent Voidborn with their own desires and goals.  We've seen that Voidborn can have conflicting desires and goals (Vel vaporizing some other Voidborn, which would never happen in a true hive-mind).  This isn't indicative of a unified collective intelligence.  This is indicative of a malign Will that controls through prodding toward it's goals rather than simply using Voidborn as its own limbs.  By all accounts, the Voidborn have a very clear concept of self and other.

This Will reached out to Malz and corrupted him.  This Will used that rebirth to prod Kog toward physical existence.  This Will apparently likes to snicker at astral dragons, too, while funneling Voidborn through intricately woven gaps in the weave of reality for the purpose of... devouring, I guess?  I'm still holding out hope that we'll get more information on the nature of this Voice beyond 'it's mysterious' and/or 'it's hungry'.
